wordpressPost.title: Reduce free radical exposure
wordpressPost.content:
If you read this blog then you know that I have been writing a lot lately about free radicals and how they can damage our cells and, how they fast forward the aging process.  They also fast forward disease and unfortunately, death.

Mother Nature has provided us with all the necessary ingredients to fight free radicals such essential nutrients and plant based foods.

Without getting too rigid or making a rapid life change, here are things you can do to reduce your exposure to free radical damage:

  • Eat organic, pesticide free foods.
  • Don’t eat foods or drink anything with dye or additives.
  • Drink only filtered and purified water.
  • Avoid exposure to chemicals (this means perfume and hairspray too).
  • Avoid exposure to pollution. Stay off busy streets when running/exercising.
  • Only get any type of X-ray when absolutely needed.
  • Only take medicines when absolutely needed.

 

It’s normal for our bodies to generate free radicals.  They are a by-product of our bodies metabolic functions like when cells use oxygen to transfer food into energy.  Our bodies expect this kind of thing so it is armed and ready to to naturally grab these suckers before they can harm us.

What our bodies can’t handle is an overload!
